alert.note: Alert for Bell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 10:17AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Bell County in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until noon CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Killeen, Temple, Harker Heights, Belton, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Salado, Little River-Academy, Troy, Holland, Stillhouse Hollow Lake, Belton Lake, Sparks, Union Grove, White Hall, Woodland, Heidenheimer, Moffat, Oscar and Pendleton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
